briefTitle: SSIs for Mental Health and Loneliness
officialTitle: Brief Internet Interventions to Support Mental Health

protocolDocument.label: Study Protocol and Statistical Analysis Plan

eligibilityCriteria.criteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* Be fluent in English
* Be 16 years old + (participants in studies 2-4 recruited on CloudResearch Connect had to be at least 18)
* Have internet access and a computer, smartphone, or tablet
* To be compensated for participation and be included in the main analysis, participants in studies 1 and 2 must meet criteria for "struggling with loneliness" (ie, a score on the 3-item loneliness screen of at least 6, and indicating that one's loneliness is causing one distress). Otherwise, participants can still participate in the study on a volunteer basis.
* To be compensated for participation and be included in the main analysis, participants in study 3 must meet criteria for "struggling with distress" (ie, a score on either the depression or anxiety subscale greater than or equal to 3 (range 0-6), as these scores are suggestive of a depressive or anxiety disorder.

Exclusion Criteria:

* Having completed the study in the past
* Failing both of the attention checks in the baseline measures.
* Spending less than 3 minutes completing the study introduction and baseline measures (ie, were very likely bots)
* Indicating, at the end of the study, that one did not complete the study seriously and that one's data should not be included in analyses.

primary.measure: Change in UCLA Loneliness Scale Version 3 at 8 weeks
primary.description: A 20-item measure of trait loneliness. Range 20-80 with higher scores indicated more severe loneliness. Included in studies 1, 3, and 4

secondary.measure: Change in UCLA Loneliness Scale Version 3 at 4 weeks
secondary.description: A 20-item measure of trait loneliness. Range 20-80 with higher scores indicated more severe loneliness. Included in studies 1 and 3

secondary.measure: Change in Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - 9-item total score at 8 weeks
secondary.description: A brief scale with subscales measuring depression, anxiety, and stress. Range 0-27 with higher scores indicating greater symptom severity. Included in all studies.

secondary.measure: Change in Depression Anxiety and Stress Scale - 9-item total score at 4 weeks
secondary.description: A brief scale with subscales measuring depression, anxiety, and stress. Range 0-27 with higher scores indicating greater symptom severity. Included in studies 1-3.

secondary.measure: Change in 3-item Mini Social Phobia Inventory at 8 weeks
secondary.description: A brief measure of social anxiety. Range 0-12 with higher scores indicating greater symptom severity. Included in studies 1 and 3

secondary.measure: Change in 3-item Mini Social Phobia Inventory at 4 weeks
secondary.description: A brief measure of social anxiety. Range 0-12 with higher scores indicating greater symptom severity. Included in studies 1 and 3

secondary.measure: Change in Short form of the General Self-Efficacy Scale at 8 weeks
secondary.description: A 6-item measure of general self-efficacy. Range 6-24 with higher scores indicating greater self-efficacy. Included in studies 1-3

secondary.measure: Change in Short form of the General Self-Efficacy Scale at 4 weeks
secondary.description: A 6-item measure of general self-efficacy. Range 6-24 with higher scores indicating greater self-efficacy. Included in studies 1-3

secondary.measure: Change in Short form of the General Self-Efficacy Scale immediately post-intervention
secondary.description: A 6-item measure of general self-efficacy. Range 6-24 with higher scores indicating greater self-efficacy. Included in studies 1-3.
secondary.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately post-intervention (roughly 30 minutes after beginning study for single-session conditions, and roughly 2 weeks after beginning study for 3-week iCBT condition)

secondary.measure: Change in Beck Hopelessness Scale - 4-item at 8 weeks
secondary.description: A brief version of a hopelessness measure. Range 4-12 with higher scores indicating more hopelessness. Included in all studies.

secondary.measure: Change in Beck Hopelessness Scale - 4-item at 4 weeks
secondary.description: A brief version of a hopelessness measure. Range 4-12 with higher scores indicating more hopelessness. Included in studies 1-3.

secondary.measure: Change in Beck Hopelessness Scale - 4-item immediately post-intervention
secondary.description: A brief version of a hopelessness measure. Range 4-12 with higher scores indicating greater hopelessness. Included in all studies.
secondary.timeFrame: Baseline, immediately post-intervention (roughly 30 minutes after beginning study for single-session conditions, and roughly 2 weeks after beginning study for 3-week iCBT condition)

secondary.measure: Change in Frequency of actions and thoughts scale at 8 weeks
secondary.description: A 12-item measure of adaptive thoughts and behaviors, improvement in which might be a target of cognitive behavioral therapy. Range 0-48 with higher scores indicating greater frequency of adaptive thoughts and behaviors. Included in all studies.

secondary.measure: Change in Frequency of actions and thoughts scale at 4 weeks
secondary.description: A 12-item measure of adaptive thoughts and behaviors, improvement in which might be a target of cognitive behavioral therapy. Range 0-48 with higher scores indicating greater frequency of adaptive thoughts and behaviors. Included in studies 1-3.
A 7-item measure of engagement with and acceptability of SSIs. Range 7-35 with higher scores indicating greater engagement with and acceptability of the SSI. Included in all studies.
secondary.timeFrame: immediately post-intervention (roughly 30 minutes after beginning study for single-session conditions, and roughly 2 weeks after beginning study for 3-week iCBT condition)

secondary.description: A 6-item measure of user-perceived intervention appeal and efficacy. Range 6-54 with higher scores indicating higher user-perceived intervention appeal and efficacy. Included in all studies.
secondary.timeFrame: immediately post-intervention (roughly 30 minutes after beginning study for single-session conditions, and roughly 2 weeks after beginning study for 3-week iCBT condition)

secondary.description: A 1-item measure of whether one experienced an insight moment as a result of the program. Range 0-1 with 1 indicating presence of an insight experience and 0 indicating a lack of insight experience. Included in all studies.
secondary.timeFrame: immediately post-intervention (roughly 30 minutes after beginning study for single-session conditions, and roughly 2 weeks after beginning study for 3-week iCBT condition)

secondary.description: A rating of program quality, from 1-5 stars with more stars indicating greater quality. Included in all studies.
secondary.timeFrame: immediately post-intervention (roughly 30 minutes after beginning study for single-session conditions, and roughly 2 weeks after beginning study for 3-week iCBT condition)

secondary.measure: Change in PROMIS Meaning and Purpose in Life - 4-item at 4 weeks
secondary.description: a 4-item measure of meaning and purpose in life. Range 4-20 with higher scores indicating a greater sense of meaning and purpose. Included in studies 2 and 3.

secondary.measure: Change in PROMIS Meaning and Purpose in Life - 4-item at 8 weeks
secondary.description: a 4-item measure of meaning and purpose in life. Range 4-20 with higher scores indicating a greater sense of meaning and purpose. Included in studies 2 and 3.
